body: I've upgraded to 2.5.1 and rebuilt a cluster. It's all working as expected now. Not sure if it was a 2.5.0 bug or if it's something I broke while testing.

I submitted 7272 and is just pending approval. But honestly, either one is
fine. Let just get this fix in. =)

On Wed, Jun 17, 2020 at 4:21 AM Rudy Steiner <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> There are two similar pr #7285
> <https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/7285> #7272
> <https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/7272> for this issue, but it's not
> assigned to any one
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/7271#issuecomment-645314325>, or
> unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AIOS2EOPITBXGIOOMEY4TZTRXCRLTANCNFSM4N5QXMSA>
> .
>
I can't find any relevant logs in the brokers log though.

@TinDang97 HTTP protocol is a text-oriented protocol. If you want to send raw bytes over WebSocket port, you need to make sure the raw data is encoded using base64 otherwise you will hit deserialization issues.

> Did you create tenant (prop) and namespace (r1) by pulsar-admin?

I didn't use pulsar admin， but `producer.send(msg);`  can work

@97arushisharma 

You can try a few things:

Can you do the following things to verify if the admin cert has the super-user permissions?

- Disable function worker: `bin/pulsar standalone -nfw -nss`.
- Configure `client.conf` to use the admin cert: `tlsCertFile:/home/Downloads/my-ca/admin.cert.pem,tlsKeyFile:/home/Downloads/my-ca/admin.key-pk8.pem`.
- Run `bin/pulsar-admin clusters list` to see if you can list the clusters.
@ALiuGuanyan there is a Rust client maintained by [@wyyerd](https://github.com/wyyerd). https://github.com/wyyerd/pulsar-rs

> @ALiuGuanyan there is a Rust client maintained by [@wyyerd](https://github.com/wyyerd). https://github.com/wyyerd/pulsar-rs

Yep, but it does not provide all Pulsar API like the official client.

> I didn't use pulsar admin， but `producer.send(msg);` can work
>
Yes, `producer.send` work without any problem but the broker doesn't auto-create new tenant and namespace. You can check pulsar logs.

> @TinDang97 HTTP protocol is a text-oriented protocol. If you want to send raw bytes over WebSocket port, you need to make sure the raw data is encoded using base64 otherwise you will hit deserialization issues.

Thanks. Have we any other way else base64?

> > I didn't use pulsar admin， but `producer.send(msg);` can work
> 
> Yes, `producer.send` work without any problem but the broker doesn't auto-create new tenant and namespace. You can check pulsar logs.

```

Thanks @sijie for the reply. I had followed the above steps, yet I am getting the following error:
```
$ bin/pulsar-admin clusters list
null
Reason: javax.ws.rs.ProcessingException: Connection refused: localhost/127.0.0.1:8443
```
I am getting this same behavious for all `pulsar-admin` commands.
Did you configure standalone to enable tls port?

Yup. I have added these in `standalone.conf`:
```
brokerServicePort=6650
webServicePort=8080
brokerServicePortTls=6651
```
Did you configure 8443?

I did not have that. Thanks. So after adding it the pulsar-admin commands work. Here is the output:
```
$ bin/pulsar-admin clusters list
"standalone"
```
But I still have this issue as to why I have to use `-nfw` with the standalone command to run it?Why am I not able to run it without `-nfw`?
@TinDang97 Sorry, I don't understand what is your question?
@97arushisharma okay. then can you try to start the standalone now?

@ALiuGuanyan sure. but if there is already a group of people developing that client, it would be great to involve in that project and help improve the client there. This would help Pulsar grow the community.
I am able to run pulsar in standalone with `-nfw`. But, it still does not run without this option.
@97arushisharma can you add `admin` to `superUserRoles` in function_worker.yml?

After adding the `superUserRoles: admin`, I am getting the following error log on running the `bin/pulsar standalone` command:

superUserRoles:

```

Can you try this?

Are you using the admin cert? If you are using the admin cert, it should have the super-user. Are you using the wrong cert?

I tried recreating the admin and broker certificate with respective common-name as `admin` and `localhost`, just to be sure I am not doing anything wrong. I also added all the TLS AUTH related properties in `functions_worker.yml`, but I am still getting the above error.
```
authenticationEnabled: true
authorizationEnabled: true
authenticationProviders:
    - "org.apache.pulsar.broker.authentication.AuthenticationProviderTls"
authorizationProvider: "org.apache.pulsar.broker.authorization.PulsarAuthorizationProvider"
superUserRoles:
    - admin
tlsEnabled: true
tlsCertificateFilePath: "/home/sqlstream/Downloads/my-ca/admin.cert.pem"
tlsKeyFilePath: "/home/sqlstream/Downloads/my-ca/admin.key-pk8.pem" 
tlsTrustCertsFilePath: "/home/sqlstream/Downloads/my-ca/certs/ca.cert.pem"
```

> @TinDang97 Sorry, I don't understand what is your question?

Thanks. ^^

To give more details it seems that it happens because of the publishers. Consumers get reconnected to the partitioned topic, but the publisher reconnects and somehow recreates the non-partitioned topic
Of course if I stop the publisher, delete the non-partitioned topic and then start the publisher - all is ok.
close this issue since 2.6.0 was released.

I add the following note in "reference-configure/log4j". If we need more info, please provide, and I'll improve it further in [PR-7297](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/7297)
> 'topic' in log4j2.appender is configurable. 
> - If you want to append all logs to a single topic, set the same topic name.
> - If you want to append logs to different topics, you can set different topic names.
@jiazhai , please help review the document.
@jiazhai , please help review the document. once it is approved, it will be added to the previous releases.
once the doc is approved, it will be added to the release 2.6.0.
In addition I didn't expect the regex consumer to fail at all, it should subscribe IMHO to what it can and not fail completely if it can't connect to some.
/pulsarbot run-failure-checks
I. think it should open a doc issue to update docs for this PR. @Jennifer88huang , could you help open an doc issue for this PR?
This is a duplicate of #7280
@sundar-10 Can you try to build this using java8?
we should return "format error" when using "tenant/ns" as a tenant name.
@sijie @cbornet @Huanli-Meng Thanks for the comments, I have addressed all of them, please take a look again.
since 2.6.0 is released, would like to close this issue.
@sijie Yeah I just tried, I am getting the same error.
Excellent blog post !
/pulsarbot run-failure-checks
@sijie @jerrypeng PTAL again, thanks

@sijie We made it work, we saw the Dockerfile and we ran the following commands and it worked:
`sudo apt-get update && \
     sudo apt-get install -y tig g++ cmake libssl-dev libcurl4-openssl-dev \
                 liblog4cxx-dev libprotobuf-dev libboost-all-dev google-mock libgtest-dev \
                 libjsoncpp-dev libxml2-utils protobuf-compiler wget \
                  curl doxygen openjdk-8-jdk-headless clang-format-5.0 \
                 gnupg2 golang-1.10-go zip unzip libzstd-dev libsnappy-dev
`

We need a special handle in `PulsarSplitManager.getSplitsForTopic` to split based also on `compactionHorizon`(contained in `CompactedTopicImpl`); so that for data before compactionHorizon, we could read from compacted topic, while data after compactionHorizon, read from non-compacted topic.

more info: 
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/wiki/PIP-19:-Pulsar-SQL
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/wiki/PIP-14:-Topic-compaction
@KannarFr thank you very much for your contribution~
/pulsarbot run-failure-checks

@sijie @jiazhai the issue is fixed by #7119 in 2.6.0. If you check https://pulsar.apache.org/admin-rest-api/?version=2.6.0#operation/setMaxProducersPerTopic you can see that all body parameters are in place
+1 Got this today

You can add configuration to file function_worker.yml  @dongschao 

```
# clientAuthenticationPlugin:
# the authentication parameter to be used by the pulsar client used in worker service
# clientAuthenticationParameters:
```

@sebbASF Thanks, It seems that jdbc's connector package has been split into multiple packages https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/pulsar/pulsar-2.6.0/connectors/. We may need to consider fix this page http://pulsar.apache.org/en/download/. Currently, you can find the correct package from here https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/pulsar/pulsar-2.6.0/connectors/.

It seems that because the `libpulsar` 2.6.0's package has not yet been released https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pulls?q=libpulsar, @codelipenghui  is releasing this package, which may take some time. Thanks @codelipenghui
@sijie Yeah i will start writing.

Thank you very much for your help，i had add this configuration，but Problems still exist，i dont use proxy  now，If I want to use pulsar functions, do I need to use a proxy ？，or   Is there any other way to solve thisproblem  ？ HTTP 401 Unauthorized   @tuteng

@zhanghaou , you see, can you fix this issue?

You see, can you put forward a pr to fix this issue? @zhanghaou
@codelipenghui @zhaijack @sijie  Has anyone else to resolve this feature?

@pushkar-engagio based on your description, it seems that you lose two bookies around the same time. The default replication setting for ledgers is 2. In this case, there will be some ledgers unavailable. In order to handle this case, you might consider increasing the number of replicas to 3 to get higher availability.

ping @zeo1995 help fix this.
LGTM

>  but producers don't configure producer names to produce messages

A producer will always have a name, either user-assigned or a unique broker-assigned name.
@amosJinCloudwise The pulsar-client is a jar that shades all the dependencies. The pulsar-client-original doesn't shade any of the dependencies.
@merlimat I am not entirely sure the exact issue yet. But that's the behavior we have been observed in a production cluster. We are still looking for what will be the cause and how to fix it.
